cards.name: Act of Repentance
cards.text:
Escalate {1}{W} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
• Abound, abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Adiran Distractor
cards.text:
Flash
When Adiran Distractor enters the battlefield, return up to one target creature you control and up to one target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor: Not all were willing to blindly trust the promise of a new world, and traveled through portals of the mind before committing to portals of the body.
cards.name: Adiran Scryers
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any type that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.flavor: For twenty years after Felice's defeat, the people of Adira were forced to learn how to survive on a dying plane.
cards.name: Adiran Survivors
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile two permanent cards from your graveyard.
You may cast Adiran Survivors from your graveyard.

cards.name: Aerida, Envious Chronomancer
cards.text:
[+1]: Draw two cards. At the beginning of your next end step, discard your hand.
[-3]: You get an emblem with “At the beginning of your upkeep, put a loyalty counter on each Aerida planeswalker you control.”
[-5]: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Aerida's Assistant

rulings.text: You can pay 'Discard your hand' even if your hand has no cards in it.

cards.text:
{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card from each of your libraries.
{1}{U}{R}, {T}, Discard your hand: Return each Study card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Aerida's Study
cards.text:
Archive 5 (As this enters the battlefield, shuffle the top five cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
You may play the top card of the archived library.
You can't play cards from your hand.

cards.flavor: While ultimately simply another piece in Aerida's puzzle, the necromancer dragon Algrin was far from a mere footnote in Adira's histories.
cards.name: Algrin's Legacy
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever Algrin's Legacy becomes the target of a spell an opponent controls, that spell's controller loses 5 life unless they discard a card.

cards.flavor: “If we must convert our greatest accomplishment into a refugee camp, then I suppose we should make sure they at the very least don't wreck the place.”
cards.name: Almgrove Ambassador
cards.text: Whenever Almgrove Ambassador blocks or becomes blocked, you may untap target creature and remove it from combat.

cards.flavor:
“I killed you once, and I can do it a second! You're nothing compared to me!”
—Aerida, to Felice
cards.name: Anarchy Storm
cards.text:
Destroy target nonbasic land.
Abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Appeal to the Ancestors
cards.text:
Escalate {2} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
• Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Add {B}{B}{G}{G}.

cards.flavor: Inspiration begets inspiration.
cards.name: Artist's Vista

rulings.text: Those players choose the color of mana.

cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. Each other player adds one mana of any color at the beginning of their next precombat main phase.

cards.flavor: As their new world unfurled before them, the mages of Arcanum couldn't help but add a touch of extravagance to the proceedings.
cards.name: Burgeoning Blooms
cards.text: Draw X cards, then abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Buy Time
cards.text:
Your life total becomes 0. Until an opponent's next turn, you can't lose the game, your opponents can't win the game, and you can't gain life.
Take an extra turn after this one.
Exile Buy Time.

cards.name: Champion of the Red Dawn
cards.text:
Lifelink
Instant and sorcery spells you control have lifelink.
{2}{R}{W}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.flavor: In life, sins flooded his veins. In death, there was nothing left but mulch.
cards.name: Chance at Redemption
cards.text: Each opponent sacrifices a creature that dealt damage this turn. You gain 2 life, then abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Charming Marauder
cards.text:
When Charming Marauder enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Recite {2}{W} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.name: Cognitive Fumigator
cards.text:
When Cognitive Fumigator enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand. You may choose a nonland card from it and exile that card. If you do, that player draws a card.
Recite {2}{U} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: With every passing day, more of Adira fell prey to the natural entropy that Felice had held off for so long, now eager to resume its work.
cards.name: Collapsing Realities
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Collapsing Realities deals 2 damage to each player.

cards.flavor: After centuries of study and preparation, the mages of Arcanum could only look on in awe as they accomplished the impossible.
cards.name: Conjure Realities
cards.text: Abound. Then search your library for a creature, instant, or sorcery card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Consuming Symbiosis
cards.text:
Escalate {G} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Target creature gets +3/+2 until end of turn.
• Target creature gains trample and hexproof until end of turn.

cards.name: Contemplate Obscurity
cards.text:
Escalate {B} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Put target permanent on top of its owner's library.
• For each library, look at the top three cards of that library, put any number of them into their owner's graveyard, then the rest back on top in any order.

cards.flavor: Interruption. Inhibition. Inspiration.
cards.name: Crystal Wave
cards.text:
Escalate {2} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Counter target spell.
• Destroy target creature.
• Discard your hand, then draw two cards.

cards.name: Culminating Chaos
cards.text:
Escalate {R}{R} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Culminating Chaos deals 2 damage to each creature and each planeswalker.
• Exile the top two cards of your library and add {R}{R}. Until end of turn, you may play those cards.

cards.name: Culminating Conspiracy
cards.text:
Escalate {U}{U} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Shuffle any number of cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards plus one.

cards.name: Culminating Despair
cards.text:
Escalate {B}{B} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Destroy target creature.
• Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

cards.name: Culminating Salvation
cards.text:
Escalate {W}{W} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
• You gain 6 life.

cards.name: Culminating Wisdom
cards.text:
Escalate {G}{G} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
• Search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.name: End of Worlds
cards.text: Each player discards their hand and sacrifices all permanents they control, draws seven cards, then abounds seven times. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Equilibrium Paladin

rulings.text: This ability will affect the creature while it is entering the battlefield, so it will lose abilities such as 'This creature enters the battlefield tapped.' and 'As this creature enters the battlefield' abilites.

cards.text:
Flash
Creatures other than Equilibrium Paladin that entered the battlefield this turn lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.

cards.name: Fading Dead
cards.text:
Other creatures get -1/-1.
Recite {1}{B} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: Through blood and through influence, Ser Fallacy far outlived her death.
cards.name: Fallacy's Channeler
cards.text:
Whenever Fallacy's Channeler becomes untapped, each player sacrifices a creature.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Fallacy's Channeler deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Fallacy's Sanctifier
cards.text:
Flash
When Fallacy's Sanctifier enters the battlefield, exile up to three target cards from graveyards.
Recite {2} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: At the spell's most tenuous point, when it seemed the spell would fail and the new world would be yet another failed experiment, a surge of fresh power stabilized the spell and carried it to completion. And from the crowd stepped a face Aerida had never expected to see again.
cards.name: Fate Charm
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Exile the top two cards of your library, then put a card exiled with Fate Charm on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Fateseeker's Orb
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, for each of your libraries, look at the top card of that library, then put it on the top or bottom of that library.
{2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

cards.name: Felice, Adira's Salvation
cards.text:
[+2]: Each player can cast only one more spell until your next turn.
[-3]: Exile all other permanents, then return them to the battlefield tapped under their owner's control. Creatures can't attack you or planeswalkers you control until your next turn.
[-8]: Return all permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: With Aerida defeated and her deeds exposed, Felice turned to the rest of Arcanum's academic elite and made her demand: to let her use their new subplane as a refuge for her people.
cards.name: Felice's Defiance
cards.text:
Exile X target permanents you control. Return them to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Felice's Study
cards.text:
Archive 5 (As this enters the battlefield, shuffle the top five cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
Whenever a permanent card is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may put that card on the bottom of the archived library.

cards.flavor:
“Stop beating around the bush and just kill the damn thing!”
—Telam, last words
cards.name: Foliage Hunter
cards.text:
Defender
Foliage Hunter has deathtouch as long as you've cast a spell this turn.

changes: 2023-05-01 — Now remains an enchantment as a creature.
cards.name: Heraldry
cards.text:
Flying, prowess
Whenever one or more creatures attack, you gain life equal to the greatest power among those creatures.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you may have Heraldry become an Angel creature in addition to its other types or stop being a creature.

cards.name: In Tragedy
cards.text:
Escalate {G} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Target creature you control gains deathtouch and indestructible until end of turn.
• Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Inspire Actuality
cards.text:
Escalate {R} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Untap all creatures you control.
• Take an extra turn after this one. Skip the untap step of that turn. Exile Inspire Actuality.

cards.flavor:
“This world is newborn and unformed. It must be carefully tended to, if it is to flourish.”
—Graide, Voice of Autumn
cards.name: Litany of Renewal
cards.text:
Each player may play an additional land on each of their turns.
Whenever a land enters the battlefield, each player may draw a card.

cards.name: Master of Masks

rulings.text: You may pay any additional or alternative costs that creature may have.
It remains a copy of that creature as it enters the battlefield.
You can cast Master of Masks with abound as a copy of any creature as long as that creature's cmc is within the abound's mana value limit.

cards.text: As long as you control an Island, you may cast this spell as a copy of any creature on the battlefield. (This includes casting cost.)

cards.name: Mirrorplate Exemplar
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell that targets only one target or activates an ability that targets only one target, copy that spell or ability for each other target it could target. Each copy targets a different one of those targets. (A spell or ability can't target itself.)

cards.flavor: She tangles the fates of three worlds, and hopes to lose her enemies in the resulting knot.
cards.name: Mystic of Many Winds
cards.text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, that player exiles the top card of each library face down.
Each player may look at and play cards they exiled with Mystic of Many Winds.

cards.flavor:
“Was it any surprise that I followed you? The only person to ever challenge me?”
—Aerida, to Felice
cards.name: Once Abandoned
cards.text:
This spell costs {G} less to cast if it targets a blue or black permanent.
Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or planeswalker.

cards.flavor:
“I considered you a friend. Now look at you. A murderer. A monster.”
—Felice, to Aerida
cards.name: Once Betrayed
cards.text:
This spell costs {1}{B} less to cast if it targets a green or white permanent.
Destroy target creature or planeswalker.

cards.flavor:
“I was a prodigy, the shining star. Yet you surpassed me, again and again!”
—Aerida, to Felice
cards.name: Once Denied
cards.text:
This spell costs {1}{U} less to cast if it targets a red or green spell.
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“How many died because of your jealousy? People that I gave everything to try and save.”
—Felice, to Aerida
cards.name: Once Scarred
cards.text:
This spell costs {R} less to cast if it targets a white or blue permanent.
Once Scarred deals 4 damage to target creature or planeswalker.

cards.flavor:
“I shared my greatest achievements with you, but you never did the same for me.”
—Aerida, to Felice
cards.name: Once Shunned
cards.text:
This spell costs {W} less to cast if it targets a black or red permanent.
Exile target nonland permanent with mana value 3 or less.

cards.name: Ophidian Oracle
cards.text:
When Ophidian Oracle enters the battlefield, draw a card, then abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)
Recite {2}{G}{G} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.flavor:
“We've been given a second chance, but time is short and the journey hard.”
—Repent, daughter of Fallacy
cards.name: Over the Horizon
cards.text:
When Over the Horizon enters the battlefield, scry 1.
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Return Over the Horizon to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Paradox Rings
cards.text:
{1}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color. Put a charge counter on Paradox Rings.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Paradox Rings and sacrifice it: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: “Wartorn, broken, and depraved. I suppose it's not their fault. They've lacked something to look up to.”
cards.name: Paragon of Purity

rulings.text: Bloodprice, coalesce, conjure, cripple, fabled, flashback, mirage, paranoia, primal, prophecy, quickdraw and casting a card with morph face down are alternative mana costs. Paying {1} to exile a revealed card with prophecy is not an alternative mana cost.
Inscribe, orchestrate, and turning a card with metamorph face up are not alternative mana costs and can still be paid, but players will be unable to play the card without paying its mana cost still.
Mana symbols that can be paid in multiple ways, such as hybrid mana, are not alternative costs.

Effects that reduce the mana cost of a spell without a new cost (such as harvest, enspirit, and delve) or that add additional costs to cast without a new cost (such as snowfall, reverberate, and jump-start) are not alternative costs.

cards.text: Players can't pay alternative costs to cast spells. (Casting a spell without paying its mana cost is an alternative cost.)

cards.flavor: The only cure is more of the same.
cards.name: Poisoned Tonic
cards.text: Whenever a player gains life, that player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Potion of Inhibition
cards.text:
At the beginning of each upkeep, if it's an extra turn, end the turn.
If a player would search a library, that player searches the top four cards of that library instead.

cards.flavor: As spell after spell was harmlessly dispelled by Felice's wards, Aerida was forcibly reminded that her foe had always been as talented as her.
cards.name: Recalculation
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}. If they do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: “There was a plan. There was a plan. There was a plan. The-”
cards.name: Refracted Thoughts
cards.text: Choose target player. Until end of turn, if a spell or ability that player controls would cause them to draw a card, each of their opponents draws a card instead.

cards.flavor: “My mother was both hero and monster, doing what was necessary to keep us all alive. I'll do whatever is necessary to be better.”
cards.name: Repent, Daughter of Fallacy
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever Repent, Daughter of Fallacy blocks or becomes blocked, it deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: Pause for the briefest of moments to consider the whirl of limbs, the tangled twists and arcs, and the display has already won.
cards.name: Root Dancer

rulings.text: If a card is being affected by multiple replacement effects, the controller of the card chooses the order that the replacement effects are applied in.

cards.text: Artifacts and lands enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Rubble Tender

rulings.text: The sacrifice isn't optional. If you can't sacrifice a land, you can still search.

cards.text:
Trample
Rubble Tender's power and toughness are each equal to the number of land cards in your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a land, then search your library for up to two land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.name: Seek Refuge
cards.text:
Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card or a land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
Abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Seeker of Horizons
cards.text:
When Seeker of Horizons enters the battlefield, reveal the top three cards of your library. You may put a permanent card from among them into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Recite {1}{U} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: It calls to the wayward and adrift, demanding to be wielded.
cards.name: Seeking Sword

cards.flavor:
“Something's after us. After me. I swear it.”
—Barten, academic
cards.name: Shroud in Paranoia
cards.text:
If a spell or ability would cause a player to discard one or more cards, that player discards that many cards at random instead.
Whenever a player discards a card, that player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Speaker of the Iris
cards.text:
Haste
When Speaker of the Iris enters the battlefield, abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)
Other creatures you control have haste.

cards.name: Spectrum Archmage

rulings.text: If you can't target a spell for Spectrum Archmage's triggered ability, you won't be able to abound.

cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Spectrum Archmage enters the battlefield, return target spell to its owner's hand, then abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Stark Copse
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {G}.
{G}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Stark Hinterlands
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {B}.
{B}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Stark Horizon
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {W}.
{W}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Stark Stream
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {U}.
{U}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Stark Wildfire
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {R}.
{R}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.flavor:
“As safe places dwindled, people became crowded. There was never enough to go around. My mother... did what was needed so that some, at least, would survive.”
—Repent, Daughter of Fallacy
cards.name: Starvation
cards.text: Each player chooses up to half the creatures they control, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.name: Strayseeker Ranger
cards.text:
When Strayseeker Ranger enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with mana value 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Recite {W}{W} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.name: Theurgist of the Depths
cards.text:
When Theurgist of the Depths enters the battlefield, for each card type, you may exile a card of that type from your graveyard. Target opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put all cards from the pile of your choice into your hand.
Recite {B}{G}{U} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: A new world created, and the gateway open. All that remained was to take that first step.
cards.name: Through Worlds
cards.text: The next creature spell you cast this turn may be cast as though it had flash and costs {1} less to cast. If it entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability of it to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.

cards.name: Unbound Horizons
cards.text:
Escalate—Return another spell you control to its owner's hand. (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Draw a card.
• Draw a card.

cards.name: Wicked Blow
cards.text:
Escalate {B} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Wicked Blow deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
• Wicked Blow deals 3 damage to target creature.
• You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Withering Husk
cards.text:
Whenever Withering Husk enters the battlefield or attacks, you may discard a card and pay 1 life. If you do, draw a card, then each opponent loses 1 life.
Recite {R} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)
